p: A less activity was reported for S. officinalis EO from Colombia that showed an anti-AChE activity with an IC 50 value of 78 mg/L [ 33] and much lower IC 50 values ranging between 326.7 and 867.4 mg/L were found by Cutillas et al. [ 13] for four Spanish S. officinalis EOs. Previously, Albano et al. [ 34] reported more interesting results against AChE (IC 50 of 50.8 mg/L) than that reported by Orhan et al. [ 35] (63.8% at a concentration 1 mg/mL) and by Ferreira et al. [ 11] (46% of inhibition at a concentration of 0.5 mg/mL) for S. officinalis essential oils collected in Portugal.
